main event: On April 5, 1966, several witnesses in Iowa City, Iowa reported seeing a disc-shaped object that was red in color and about the size of a grapefruit, visible for ten minutes before disappearing behind cloud cover.
interesting points: The object was initially thought to be a star by the witnesses before it disappeared behind the clouds., The sighting occurred over a period of ten minutes., Multiple highly reliable witnesses, including police officers, reported the sighting., The report concludes the object was likely an astro (star/planet), ruling out aircraft or satellite as explanations., There was no physical evidence of the sighting found according to the investigation.
sighted object: disc-shaped object, red in color, about the size of a grapefruit
witness description: highly reliable individuals, including civilian observers and police officers
